definition: lit. the more you touch things up, the darker they get/fig. to only make matters worse
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
to depict/to trace (a drawing)/to copy/to touch up
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
black/dark/sinister/secret/shady/illegal/to hide (sth) away/to vilify/(loanword) to hack (computing)

sentences.english: Her awkward attempt to explain her error merely added insult to injury.
sentences.chinese: 她笨拙地企图解释所犯的错误，结果只是越描越黑。

sentences.english: Introverted boss immediately tense up, quickly explained, but the more black.
sentences.chinese: 内向的老板马上紧张起来，赶紧解释，却越描越黑。

sentences.english: Her awkward attempt to tell her error merely added insult to injury.
sentences.chinese: 她笨拙地企图解析所犯的错误，结果只是越描越黑。

sentences.english: She woodenly attempted to explain her mistake, but it was just adding insult to injury.
sentences.chinese: 她笨拙地企图解释所犯的错误，结果只是越描越黑。

definition: lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to confess without being pressed/to make a confession without duress
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
even an honest and upright official will have difficulty resolving a family dispute (proverb)
pinyin: qing1 guan1 nan2 duan4 jia1 wu4 shi4

definition: in the wrong
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
to say a matter has no relationship with the individual referred to, to emphasise one is innocent or in the clear
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
three men talking makes a tiger (idiom); repeated rumor becomes a fact
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
to dispute/to refute
